results.title: A Real rodeo. Fun fair. Felix out of luck. [compilation]
results.brief_description: A compilation of three short films. 1. A Real rodeo: Roping and typing a steer contest; horse and rider in bucking contest; steer bulldogging; queen of the rodeo. 2. Fun fair: Swing high - swing low; the gypsy’s warning; on the target; merry-go-round; steam-boat swing 3. Felix out of luck: animated cartoon.

results.title: A Rat in the building
results.brief_description: This clever clay animation film centres around a gathering of elderly women neighbours who meet for their weekly gossip. Item number one on the agenda, “rats” (whom one presumes represents men), and those women who are devilish enough to keep them in a building that prohibits their existence. Adapted from a short story by Olga Masters and featuring the voices of Penny Biggins and Gretel Killeen.

results.title: A Rat's tale = Die Story von Monty Spinnerratz
results.creator_credit: Michael F. Huse, Hans Peter Clahsen, Warner Bros Pictures and Monty Filmgesellschaft
results.brief_description: Featuring marionettes from Germany’s Augsburger Puppet Theatre, this is a love story with a difference, where the action is below the city streets and the star crossed lovers are rodents. The story is a combination of the children’s book by Tor Seidler and illustrated by Fred Marcellino, and an elaboration on a short story pilot by Monty Spinnerratz. Isabella Noble-Rat is swept off her feet by Monty Mad-Rat Jnr. after an impressive tour of New York’s underground sewers. Her parents are against their daughter’s union with someone beneath their station, much to Isabella’s chagrin. There are bigger issues at hand however as the rat community is threatened by rising drain waters and a proposed mass extermination of the rodent community. Perhaps Isabella’s beau can save the day and impress her snooty parents at the same time. Cast includes Beverly D’Angelo, Jerry Stiller, Josef Ostendorf and Lauren Hutton, and featuring the voices of Lynsey Bartilson, Ray Guth, Scott MacDonald and Donald Arthur.

results.title: A Rag tapestry by 25 children
results.creator_credit: George Zabriskie, Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description: A series of workshops for children at the Metropolitan Museum of Art reveals the entire process involved in making a rag tapestry. Follows process from initial concept through drawing to production. Using wool scraps the 8-12 year-olds create, at little cost, a colorful 3 x 10 foot tapestry.
results.creator_credit_for_label: George Zabriskie, Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation

results.title: A Race against people: the story of Hong Kong's re-housing programme
results.creator_credit: British Information Services and Hong Kong Film Unit
results.brief_description: The story of Hong Kong’s Re-housing Program. The re-settlement of new migrants and other Chinese members of the community in to high-rise housing provided by the authorities at public expense. Commentary by Eamonn Andrews.

results.title: A Question of time
results.creator_credit: Don Levy, Stephen Toulmin, Judy Goodfield and Nuffield Foundation
results.brief_description: Treats in a new cinematic manner man’s unequal struggle to gain an intellectual grasp on the idea of time, its origin, measurement and place in theoretical physics. An exploration of the concept of time reduced to a human scale and ranging through the major historical developments; mans first notion of time; its relation to movement and more recent concepts of biological time, time in relativistic terms.

results.title: A Question of Balance
results.brief_description: This program looks at the issue of woodchipping and forestry management in Australia, with special emphasis on the South East Forest region of Victoria and NSW, and asks the question…What’s it worth to disrupt the balance? With the advent of the Greenhouse Effect it is now imperative that we look carefully and critically at how we manage our environment.

results.title: A Question of balance
results.creator_credit: Steve Christiansen, Mat Scully and ACT Schools Authority
results.brief_description: Examines the role of the arts in the education system. Emphasis is placed upon the role in which the arts helps develop self awareness, self esteem and creative ability in children.

results.title: A Question of attitude
results.creator_credit: Stuart Glover, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Discusses the problem of finding work for physically handicapped people, showing many examples of successful workers in varied skilled positions. Argues that employers’ reluctance to make positions available is the main difficulty.
